title: Nick Cannon tries to keep his five-year-old twins grounded | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share 'I don't want my kids to be entertainers, but they have it,' he laughed. 'They're little hams - they see a microphone, they run for it.' As for what he'd really like his twins to do: 'I want some astronauts! Some heart surgeons! Can a Cannon get to space?' However, if they do decide to go into showbiz, Nick is going 'to put 'em through it' and teach them not to expect special breaks because of their parents. 'If they want to be entertainers, God bless 'em. It's gonna be easy for them to be entertainers,' he said. 'I think as a parent, you want to encourage trying and effort, and putting hard work to the test to show something you can actually accomplish. They're not camera shy: The tots stuck out their tongues as Nick took an Instagram selfie 'I'm gonna make sure, one, school gotta be right. 'If you want to be a singer, sing in the choir at school. If you want to be an actor, act in a school play first.' Go through that process that every kid has to go through.' Nick, whose comedy show Stand-Up Don't Shoot debuts on Showtime on Friday, says his present goal is to be there to help his kids pave their own path. And he'll soon have another child to help along the way. Nick is expecting a baby boy with former Miss Arizona Brittany Bell. The couple aren't together but Nick is determined to be part of his son's life. Family Dinner!': Nick posted an Instagram photo of himself with his ex, Mariah Carey, twins Monroe and Morocco and his mother on January 5
